awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: NSF-CBMS Regional Conference on      Arrangements of Hyperplanes; June 6-10, 1988; Flagstaff,    Arizona
awd_abstract_narration: The subject of this conference, Arrangements of Hyperplanes,                    draws on a number of difficult topics in algebra and geometry.                  Professor Orlik of the University of Wisconsin-Madison will serve               as principal lecturer, delivering a series of ten lectures, and                 several eminent researchers in the field will be invited                        participants.  The lectures will include an historical survey,                  and discourses on combinatorial, algebraic, and topological                     methods in the theory of arrangements, properties of arrangements               associated with reflection groups, the K(pi,1) problem, and                     other current research in the area.  There will also be several                 informal problem sessions.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
